means: （因财富和社会地位而仅有部分人享有的）权益

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"权利"之意。
means: right ： 普通用词，指某人或某物拥有符合法律、道义或道德的权利。
privilege ： 指特许或恩施的权利，也指一般人或物所没有的有利条件。

sentence.Network_en: Pironi was the son of privilege and wealth, and it showed.
sentence.Network_cn: 皮罗尼出身于有钱有势的豪门，这看得出来。

sentence.Network_en: She was cocooned in a private world of privilege.
sentence.Network_cn: 她生活在一个与世隔绝的特权世界里。

sentence.Network_en: It must be a privilege to know such a man.
sentence.Network_cn: 认识这样的人肯定很荣幸。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... privation n 剥夺；缺乏 privilege n 特权 privy a 秘密的.
新大纲四级 - xieyuchao670的日志 - 网易博客 ... prisoner 囚徒 privilege 特权，优惠 probable 很可能的，大概的.
权限（privilege）:Oracle数据库预先定义好的、执行某些操作的能力。角色（role）:一组相关权限的集合。
星尘的天空 - 博客园 ... 31：facial n 美容，美颜 32：privilege n 特权；好处；荣幸 33：paradise n 天堂，乐土.

list.abs: 所谓最小特权（Least Privilege），指的是“在完成某种操作时所赋予网络中每个主体（用户或进程）必不可少的特权”；最小特权原则…
石油词汇英语翻译(P) ... privatization 私有化 privileged instruction 特许指令 privileged mode 特许方式.
茶叶男 - 天涯问答 ... would be so nice to meet ya 我都会很高兴遇到你 Privileged instruction 特权指令 open source 开源代码.
电信专业词汇浏览文章上海力友翻译网 ... 访问日志 Access Log 访问特权，接入特许 Access Privileges 放号 Number allocation.
Serv-U_入侵破解_电脑学习网(Xue5.CoM) ... “No privilege” （普通帐号）。 “Finish” （结束）即完成设置现在已经建立好了一个.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin privilegium 'bill or law affecting an individual', from privus 'private' + lex, leg- 'law'

entry.tran: （某人或某团体独享的）特权，优惠
entry.def: A privilege is a special right or advantage that only one person or group has.

example.ex: The Russian Federation has issued a decree abolishing special privileges for government officials.
example.tran: 俄罗斯联邦已经颁布法令废除政府官员的特权。

example.ex: ...the ancient powers and privileges of the House of Commons.
example.tran: 国会下议院古老的权力和特权

entry.tran: （常指因财富、社会地位而享有的）特权，优惠
entry.def: If you talk about privilege, you are talking about the power and advantage that only a small group of people have, usually because of their wealth or their high social class.

example.ex: Pironi was the son of privilege and wealth, and it showed...
example.tran: 皮罗尼出身于有钱有势的豪门，这看得出来。

example.ex: Having been born to privilege in old Hollywood, she was carrying on a family tradition by acting.
example.tran: 她出身于过去好莱坞的名门，继承了当演员的家族传统。

entry.def: You can use privilege in expressions such as be a privilege or have the privilege when you want to show your appreciation of someone or something or to show your respect.

example.ex: It must be a privilege to know such a man...
example.tran: 认识这样的人肯定很荣幸。

example.ex: I once had the privilege of meeting the late philosopher CLR James.
example.tran: 我曾经有幸和已故的哲学家C.L.R.詹姆士会面。

entry.tran: 特殊对待；给予…特权；给予…优待
entry.def: To privilege someone or something means to treat them better or differently than other people or things rather than treat them all equally.

example.ex: We want to privilege them because without the top graduate students, we can't remain a top university...
example.tran: 我们希望给予这些最顶尖的研究生特别照顾，因为没有他们，我们就无法继续处于一流大学之列。

example.ex: They are privileging a tiny number to the disadvantage of the rest.
example.tran: 他们优待少数几个人，使其他人处于不利的境地。

means.word_mean: 1. a special advantage or immunity or benefit not enjoyed by all
2. a right reserved exclusively by a particular person or group (especially a hereditary or official right);

sentences.sentence: "suffrage was the prerogative of white adult males"

means.word_mean: 3. (law) the right to refuse to divulge information obtained in a confidential relationship

auth_sentence.content: Marital privilege pervades nearly every facet of our lives.
auth_sentence.res_content: Marital privilege pervades nearly every facet of our lives.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Marital privilege pervades nearly every facet of our lives.

auth_sentence.content: There is no "executive privilege" for God.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is no "executive privilege" for God.

auth_sentence.content: However they come with a premium for the privilege.
auth_sentence.res_content: However they come with a premium for the privilege.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However they come with a premium for the privilege.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 私人的,个人的,秘密的,私下的

stems_affixes.word_buile: priv单个+y……的,人→个人的→秘密的,引申为有厉害关系的人
private个人的+ly表副词→adv.私下地, 秘密地
deprive[v.剥夺,夺去,使丧失]+ation表名词→n.剥夺,丧失

stems_affixes.value_cn: [不受干扰的]独处,自由,隐私;私生活
stems_affixes.word_buile: priv单个+acy表名词→n.[不受干扰的]独处,自由,隐私;私生活
privi=priv单个+lege法律→有个人法律→特权
priv单个+y……的,人→个人的→秘密的,引申为有厉害关系的人
de去掉+priv单个+e→从个人身边拿走→剥夺
privi=priv单个+lege法律→有个人法律→特权

Sentence.sentence: Around the same time, I noticed that those who part with $2285 a night to stay in a cliff-top room at the Post Ranch Inn in Big Sur, California, pay partly for the privilege of not having a TV in their rooms; the future of travel, I'm reliably told, lies in "black-hole resorts," which charge high prices precisely because you can't get online in their rooms

jushi.english: As a member of the nobility, his life had been one of wealth and privilege.
jushi.chinese: 身为贵族中的一员，他过着有钱有势的生活。

jushi.english: They are entitled to enjoy many advantages and privileges.
jushi.chinese: 他们有资格享有许多优惠和特权。
